title: Policy Oscillation
description: Detects when institutions rapidly change policies back and forth, creating confusion and instability that can lead to erasure through inconsistency and policy fatigue.
indicators: Frequent reversals of eligibility or funding policies within short timeframes
Patterns of uncertainty where rules are changed and then reversed, causing instability for affected groups
Evidence that the oscillation itself leads to certain narratives or participants being marginalized due to constant uncertainty
